articles.author: Emma Jones
articles.title: Too Much: What film and TV get wrong about London - BBC
articles.description: Films and TV shows have created a glamorous "Notting Hill" version of the UK's capital city. A new Lena Dunham series pokes fun at the stereotypes Americans believe about the country.
articles.content: Of course, London has been portrayed in different ways throughout cinema history, including its bombed-out ruins after World War Two, in films such as 1949's Passport to Pimlico. The city's edgier si… [+546 chars]

articles.author: Elizabeth Cooney
articles.title: Nearly 1 in 3 teens have prediabetes, CDC finds, in ‘wake-up call’ - STAT
articles.description: Nearly 1 in 3 American adolescents have prediabetes, a CDC report finds. An official notes "it’s not too late to change course."
articles.content: About 1 in 3 young people who are 12 to 17 years old have prediabetes, new national data show, putting them at risk not just for type 2 diabetes but also for heart disease and stroke. Developing chro… [+6568 chars]
